prompt: Discuss the ethical challenges in big data collection and analysis.

criteria.name: Understanding of Ethical Issues
criteria.description: Demonstrates knowledge of key ethical concerns in big data.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Clearly explains privacy, consent, bias, and data security issues in detail.
performance_descriptors.good: Describes at least two major ethical issues (e.g., privacy, consent).
performance_descriptors.average: Mentions ethical concerns but with little detail.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Basic or unclear understanding of ethics in big data.

criteria.name: Analysis of Impact
criteria.description: Analyzes how ethical challenges affect individuals and organizations.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Insightfully discusses consequences and risks for users and organizations.

criteria.name: Use of Real-World Examples
criteria.description: Provides examples of ethical challenges in big data.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Multiple, relevant examples with clear explanations.
performance_descriptors.good: At least one clear example provided.
performance_descriptors.average: Example is vague or minimally described.

criteria.name: Structure and Academic Style
criteria.description: Presents answer in a logical, academic style.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Highly organized, formal, and clear response.
performance_descriptors.good: Clear structure and mostly formal style.

key_points: Explains privacy, consent, bias, and security as key issues
Analyzes risks for individuals (loss of privacy, discrimination) and organizations (reputation, legal penalties)
Gives real-world examples (Cambridge Analytica, health data breaches, biased algorithms)
llm_questions: What are the main ethical issues in big data collection?
Why is privacy important in big data analysis?
How can bias affect big data results?
Can you give examples of ethical challenges in real life?
What happens if companies ignore data ethics?
